entities.description: Sampling strata within each state, partitioned into regions for interview during data collection.
Geographical sub-division within states used for sampling in studies.
Dwelling Unit, used to define minimum size requirements for both urban and rural areas.
Primary Sampling Units, used within the selected census tracts for the study.
Core-Based Statistical Area used for socioeconomic status analysis.
Categories used to define statistical area and socioeconomic status indicators.
Classification of the area within census tracts with specific minimum DU requirements.
Classification of the area outside urban areas with specific minimum DU requirements.

relationships.description: A state contains several SSRs for sampling.
Each SSR includes one or more census tracts.
Census tracts have defined minimum DU requirements for sampling.
Areas in census tracts are classified based on DU requirements.
Areas outside census tracts are classified based on DU requirements.
The study uses primary sampling units within selected census tracts.
Sampling applies socioeconomic status indicators from CBSA.
